headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Burundi: New Offensive Against Rebels

lead_paragraph: Heavy fighting was reported northeast of the capital, Bujumbura, as government soldiers mounted a major offensive to drive back Hutu rebels of the National Liberation Forces from their stronghold in the forested area of Tenga. Ethnic clashes in Burundi dating to 1993 have killed some 250,000 people. The latest fighting broke out after a new government in which Tutsi and Hutu share power was sworn in this month. Marc Lacey (NYT)
abstract: Heavy fighting is reported in Burundi as government soldiers mount major offensive to drive back Hutu rebels of National Liberation Forces from their stronghold in Tenga (S)
